column4: i plugged in camera to usb, powered on camera, but no icon on desktop. when i do the same with my iPod, it works. lsusb indicates recognition of camera
is camera setup to work as usb drive? otherwise check if it works with some pics program as PTP.
i don't know. how do i figure out answer to your question?
you there?
yes, sorry, not watching channel much.
question: how can i figure out whether my camera is set up to work as USB drive?
can you check in camera's settings? my old hp had that setting there
you mean on my camera itself?
what type of camera you have? and yes, on camera, not pc
canon powershot a60 ... is rather old.
my canon works in PTP mode. try open f-spot and if that can recognize it.
i don't think my canon powershot a60 has a "usb drive" option in the camera's settings.
yes, i don't think either, i think canon cameras work only in PTP mode. therefore you won't see it as usb drive on your desktop. but it should pop up with "what you wanna do" if you connect.
what do you mean by  "what you wanna do"
basicaly will ask you what you want to do, if download pics etc. similar to windows popup windows if you wanna play/download, open folder etc..
if you plug camera in, type dmesg in command line, if you get any output bout camera
goin away for a bit.
no i don't get that "what would you want to do" window.
you back yet? i did dmesg, but don't know if i found camera
it should tell you bout new usb being attached to pc. is cable ok?
cable itself is ok. indeed, lsusb indicates recognition of camera
have you tried to do it thru f-spot if you can download pics?
